body_html:
@sanjoy I have three points:

  1. When compiling AOT tests with tensorflow 1.5 version, the compilation errors are not related to pywrap_tensorflow_internal. See again the log that I attached to the previous comment:
    gcc5_tensorflow_v1.5_abi0.log

  2. I tried to query for the dependencies of pywrap_tensorflow_internal. I am a novice in bazel, so I am not sure if I used the correct command. Here is the command that I used and the output:
    bazel query "deps(//tensorflow/python:pywrap_tensorflow_internal)" &>pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt
    pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt

  3. Sorry for a beginner question, but I do I pass the cmake option from bazel? I tried this, but it doesn't work:
    cd tensorflow/compiler/aot/tests ; bazel build -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS=OFF --cxxopt="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0" all_tests
body_text:

When compiling AOT tests with tensorflow 1.5 version, the compilation errors are not related to pywrap_tensorflow_internal. See again the log that I attached to the previous comment:
gcc5_tensorflow_v1.5_abi0.log


I tried to query for the dependencies of pywrap_tensorflow_internal. I am a novice in bazel, so I am not sure if I used the correct command. Here is the command that I used and the output:
bazel query "deps(//tensorflow/python:pywrap_tensorflow_internal)" &>pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt
pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt


Sorry for a beginner question, but I do I pass the cmake option from bazel? I tried this, but it doesn't work:
cd tensorflow/compiler/aot/tests ; bazel build -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS=OFF --cxxopt="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0" all_tests
body:
@sanjoy I have three points:
1) When compiling AOT tests with tensorflow 1.5 version, the compilation errors are not related to pywrap_tensorflow_internal. See again the log that I attached to the previous comment: 
[gcc5_tensorflow_v1.5_abi0.log](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1652635/gcc5_tensorflow_v1.5_abi0.log)

2) I tried to query for the dependencies of pywrap_tensorflow_internal. I am a novice in bazel, so I am not sure if I used the correct command. Here is the command that I used and the output:
bazel query "deps(//tensorflow/python:pywrap_tensorflow_internal)" &>pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt
[pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1652627/pywrap_tensorflow_internal_deps.txt)

3) Sorry for a beginner question, but I do I pass the cmake option from bazel? I tried this, but it doesn't work:
cd tensorflow/compiler/aot/tests ; bazel build -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS=OFF --cxxopt="-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0" all_tests
